intro: Cassinopsis, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Cassinopsis species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions. They play an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
